sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: To run Lights Off, select ApplicationsGamesLights Off, or type lightsoff in the command line.
Lights Off is included in the gnome-games package, which is part of the GNOME desktop environment. This document describes version &version; of Lights Off.

sect1.title: Playing Lights Off
sect1.para: You can score through two actions: completing lines and dropping blocks quickly.

sect2.title: Moving the Blocks
sect2.para: To play the game, you only need the four arrow keys.

listitem.para: Left and Right move the block correspondingly across the screen.
Up rotates the block. The default rotation is counterclockwise. You can change the rotation under SettingsPreferences and deselecting Rotate blocks counterclockwise.
Down and the Space Bar move the block down the screen faster.Down moves the block down faster. Space-bar moves the block directly to the bottom.

sect2.title: Starting a New Game
sect2.para: To begin a new game, go to GameNew Game. The game will begin dropping blocks from the center of the top of the window. The default start-up of the game has no blocks in the game window and shows the next block that will fall in the upper right hand corner. Score shows the number of points you have earned. Lines shows the number of lines you have completed. Level shows the level of difficulty you are on.

sect2.title: Customizing the Look of Lights Off
sect2.para: Under SettingsPreferences, you can customize the look of Lights Off: images for the blocks.

sect3.title: Block Image
sect3.para: You can change the style of the blocks, including image and size. There are a variety of pre-made styles.

sect3.title: Background
sect3.para: If you drag your favorite image into the Lights Off window it will be used as the background. If you want a solid color as the background drag one in from either the color picker or from nautlilus' Backgrounds and Emblems dialog (the reset item from that dialog also works).
